\text{After diffrentiating the equation we get}\\ \frac{d(\sin^2 x + \cos^2 y)}{dx}=\frac{d(1)}{dx}\\ \Rightarrow 2\sin x \cos x \frac{d(x)}{dx}+2\cos y (-\sin y) \frac{d(y)}{dx} = 0\\ \Rightarrow \sin 2 x -\sin 2y \frac{dy}{dx} = 0 \\
\text{After rearranging, we get}\\ \frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{\sin 2x}{\cos 2y}
